issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: NC epoch checks no reset when front-end components reset epoch to zero

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I've seen this consistently in systems installed and configured by kickstart scripts in the new data center. Outwardly, I'm not able to attach volumes to instances. Here's what [~zhill] said;

I've seen this behavior before. There is an issue (not consistently reproducible) where the CC correctly puts the SC in the disabled/notready list but it never seems to transition to the enabled list when the SC is back up. The workaround is to restart the CC service.
fields.summary: SC isn't seen as enabled by CC

comments.body: I'm seeing this after installing last night's packages on a fresh cloud. I've attached logs from the front-end.

Have seen it on 05-18-2013 in UI cloud CLC 10.101.1.36 
{code}

Here is what I am seeing on the NC that {{Failed to lookup enabled Storage Controller}}:

{code}
2013-05-18 14:39:28 DEBUG 000006370 doDescribeResource       | returning status=enabled cores=16/16 mem=7795/7795 disk=4787/4787 iqn=iqn.1994-05.com.redhat:70b0f84c829d

2013-05-18 14:39:28 TRACE 000006370 printNCServiceStateInfo  | Notready Service -

2013-05-18 14:39:28 TRACE 000006370 printMsgServiceStateInfo | Msg-Meta epoch 30
2013-05-18 14:39:28 TRACE 000006370 printMsgServiceStateInfo | Msg-Meta: Service - cc_01 cluster01 cluster http://10.101.1.36:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC
2013-05-18 14:39:28 TRACE 000006370 printMsgServiceStateInfo | Msg-Meta: Service - 10.101.1.36 eucalyptus dns http://10.101.1.36:8773/services/Dns
2013-05-18 14:39:28 TRACE 000006370 printMsgServiceStateInfo | Msg-Meta: Service - 10.101.1.36 eucalyptus eucalyptus http://10.101.1.36:8773/services/Eucalyptus
2013-05-18 14:39:28 TRACE 000006370 printMsgServiceStateInfo | Msg-Meta: Service - sc_01 cluster01 storage http://10.101.1.36:8773/services/Storage

2013-05-18 14:39:28 TRACE 000006370 printMsgServiceStateInfo | Msg-Meta: Notready Service -

2013-05-18 14:39:28 TRACE 000006370 printMsgServiceStateInfo | Msg-Meta: Notready Service -    
2013-05-18 14:39:28 TRACE 000006370 printMsgServiceStateInfo | Msg-Meta: Notready Service - 
{code}

In other words, it was not picking up the 'storage' service as enabled. After I restarted the NC, it picked the service. I suspect this was due to epoch rollback that occurs when CLC is restarted. Check of the {{cloud-output.log}} confirms that the CLC was restarted multiple times:

{code}
# grep "Creating Bootstrapper instance" /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-output.log 
2013-05-17 16:58:03  INFO | Creating Bootstrapper instance.
2013-05-17 16:58:54  INFO | Creating Bootstrapper instance.
2013-05-17 16:59:20  INFO | Creating Bootstrapper instance.
2013-05-17 16:59:47  INFO | Creating Bootstrapper instance.
2013-05-17 17:02:03  INFO | Creating Bootstrapper instance.
{code}

That leads me to believe that this behavior is resolved by EUCA-6204. Thus, moving back to QA.

Should be resolved as of 

* eucalyptus 1c58ffe858c2401278886f33b7e3b1c0c3f8d692
* internal 22d2c431eea1f752c7652096a154a71361afa560
I'm curious what the best way to trigger this condition was so that I can QA that it's been fixed. [~dkavanagh]?

Excellent question. I used a couple of cobbler profiles in the new DC to configure a cloud and this issue "showed up". I really can't say why, so it is hard to tell you what to do. It was very repeatable though. I ran those same scripts a few times and kept having the trouble.
I re-installed the same cloud in the new DC last week and was just able to verify that volume attach is working. I would assume this is taken care of since I could never get attach working before.
Unless there's objection, I'll mark this as fixed based upon your verification.
